head.supplied: ¶ [F von Mueller Asking for the use of a room for the Leichart ¶ i.e. Leichhardt. A subsequently discredited report by J. Skuthorpe claiming to have found traces of Leichhardt had prompted M to press...

div.p: No. 282, unit 7, VPRS 4026/P1 inward correspondence registers, Melbourne City Council, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Letter not found; item is a register entry only, of a letter to the Mayor dated 26 February 1880.
[F von Mueller Asking for the use of a room for the Leichart
i.e. Leichhardt. A subsequently discredited report by J. Skuthorpe claiming to have found traces of Leichhardt had prompted M to press for a new search for the missing explorer to be undertaken;seeM to the Editor of the Age, 20 February 1880 (in this edition as 80-02-20a).Bringing a committee together would have been the first step in organizing a search; there is, however, no evidence that such a meeting took place or, if it did, that it led to any action.
search committee.]
